review: overwatch 1 was better up until GOATS, game is ruined now

Only vaguely knew the game existed before Season 1. The gameplay is great, kinda reminds me of playing S4 League. On role queues playing Support and DPS is fun time to time, and on Tank it's really fun unless the other team knows what they're doing. For the community, it's the same as what you'd get on other games. Only exception is the online forums where players are unnecessarily toxic. Overall worth playing for a casual fun.

1000+ hours on Battle.net

Competitive is still broken.
Blizzard refuses to deal with the problem of cheaters, throwers, and leavers.  These IPs need to be banned for life from comp.
Players intentionally lose to remain in a lower SR or just to troll.
Went 5 and 0 without any increase in rank.
Matchmaking is horrible with most matches being very one sided, especially in Solo queue.
If anyone has insight to how SR really works, please feel free to comment. Because at this point I have no idea.

PvE was supposed to be included in the Free 2 Play model of OverWatch 2 which is why there was a long content drought in OW1.  It is now $15 for 3x ~15min missions you'll likely play once.
tbh this game is tons of fun gameplay wise but because of the team behind it and their "interesting decisions" its alot more fun to just shit on this game

ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.
